title: Question 8
prompt:
A company has 200 employees who are eligible for child care benefits. The company will pay eligible employees 25% of child day care costs, up to a maximum of $500 per child per month.

c= Number of children of eligible employees

Which of the following formulas shows the maximum amount of day care the company might need to pay in a year?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The maximum amount of day care the company might need to pay in a year would be $500 per month, for 12 months, for each child of an eligible employee. This is the same as 500 times 12 times c, the number of children of eligible employees.

$500 per month for 12 months for each child of eligible employee is

(500×12)×c
